page.title: 15HULL AND BARNSLEY RAILWAY.
page.content: Last Monday we went on a walk. We came to a long flat topped hill and we found out that it is the embankment of the now disused{Hull and Barnsley} {Railway}- the last large independent railway to be built in England. The plans to build the 50 miles long railway were published in 1880 and it was opened in{1885}at a cost of Â£4m. It was built to transport coal from South Yorkshire to Hull docks. After 37 years the{N.E.R.}took control of the line. The track was built on an embankment so that there would be no level crossings. The line closed to passengers in 1955 and finally in 1964. Springhead Engine Works closed in 1972. Only a small section of the line remains open. This year is the {centenary of the railway and special {exhibitions}are being held.
